channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman explains why he's been "voting consistently" to reopen the government
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania says he's been "voting consistently" to reopen the government because it's "always wrong" to shut it down. He says...

item.title: Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide
item.description: The Supreme Court has rejected a call to overturn its landmark decision that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide.

item.title: LIVE: ABC News Live
item.description: 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events

item.title: Government shutdown timeline: How senators went from 40-day impasse to sudden deal
item.description: The longest government shutdown in U.S. history appears to be nearing its end, after senators quickly advanced a funding deal over the weekend.

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman on health care protections: "We have to negotiate" with Republicans
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman says Republicans and Democrats "have different priorities," but health care protections and making health care more affordable is ...

item.title: Supreme Court denies request to revisit same-sex marriage ruling
item.description: The judges will not revisit the landmark 2015 decision in Obergefell v Hodges.

item.title: WATCH: Johnson tells House to begin returning to Washington to start end of shutdown
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson spoke Monday morning about next steps in ending the government shutdown, saying he will call the House back as soon as the ...

item.title: What Trump's 50-year mortgage plan could mean for homebuyers
item.description: Details are still sparse, but a 50-year loan could meaningfully reshape a housing market where 30 years is the norm.

item.title: Who qualifies for the potential $2,000 tariff dividend? Here's what to know
item.description: Questions abound about who qualifies and whether enough funds are available.

item.title: While Trump threatens controllers, US flight cancellations will drag on even after shutdown ends
Airlines cancel thousands more flights in U.S. over government shutdown
item.description: Airlines are expected to cancel 4% of Monday's flights at 40 of the busiest airports in the U.S. to comply with an order from the FAA.

item.title: Arctic air hits much of the US, bringing snow to some areas and very chilly temperatures to Florida
Sen. John Fetterman slams lawmakers fundraising amid shutdown: "I refuse to monetize the outrage"
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman slammed lawmakers who are fundraising as Americans face "mass chaos" at airports, food uncertainty and missed paychecks during the...
